DOCNAME: CASE OF PARIZOV v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant and CARDINAL other persons instituted civil proceedings before the then ORG ( Општински Суд Штип ) for annulment of a care agreement ( “ the agreement ” ) ( договор за доживотна издршка ) concluded on DATE between the applicant ’s late father and his step - mother ( “ the defendant ” ) . They maintained that the applicant ’s late father had been in a fit condition and that he had sufficient financial means to take care of himself and that , accordingly , there had been no need for the agreement under which , the defendant had been granted MONEY , a priceless ancient icon and a land .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG partially upheld the applicant ’s claim and annulled the agreement . It declared , inter alia , that the icon would be included in the applicant ’s late father ’s inheritance , but it dismissed the claim concerning DATE . That decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE both parties appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the then ORG ( ORG суд ) dismissed the appeals and upheld the lower court ’s decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the applicant ’s appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) submitted on DATE . It remitted the case for a renewed consideration since the first - instance court had not given sufficient reasons for its decision .
CARDINAL . The proceedings resumed on DATE . Of CARDINAL hearings fixed before the first - instance court , none was postponed upon the applicant ’s request .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave the same decision as on DATE in which it established that the applicant ’s father had been amongst the richest people in his village ; that he had been in a fit condition and that , by entering into the agreement , the defendant had acquired considerable interest ( значителна имотна корист ) which had not been in compliance with the then ORG order ( општествено уредување ) . It dismissed the applicant ’s claim concerning DATE since there had been no evidence that the applicant ’s father had been in possession of any .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed . On DATE he submitted observations in reply to the defendant ’s appeal , together with an addendum to his appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG set aside the first - instance court ’s decision since it had not complied with ORG instructions .
CARDINAL . The proceedings resumed on DATE . CARDINAL hearings were held before the first - instance court , of which none was adjourned upon the applicant ’s request .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partially upheld the applicant ’s claim . It declared that only the icon be included in his late father ’s inheritance and dismissed the claim for annulment of the agreement . It further reiterated its earlier findings as to the golden liras . The decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG overturned the decision and decided the case itself . It declared the agreement null and void , but considered it as having been concluded as a gift contract ( договор за подарок ) . It upheld the remainder of the first - instance court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant filed an appeal on points of law before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the defendant ’s appeal and quashed ORG decision . It further instructed that court to establish whether the agreement had been concluded in a statutory form .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG remitted the case for re - examination before the first - instance court . The decision was served on the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the first - instance court scheduled CARDINAL hearings , of which CARDINAL was adjourned because of the applicant ’s fault . During that time , the applicant lodged CARDINAL submissions before the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partially upheld the applicant ’s claim - it declared that the agreement be invalid and considered it as having been concluded as a gift contract .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the defendant ’s appeal of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case for re - consideration .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance declared the applicant ’s claim as withdrawn , as he had not appeared in court despite being duly summoned . It so ruled as the case concerned a dispute of minor value .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG set aside that decision arguing that the case could not be regarded as a dispute of minor value .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance dismissed the applicant ’s claim for annulment of the agreement finding that the latter had met the statutory requirements . That decision was given after a hearing fixed for DATE had been adjourned due to the applicant ’s absence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal and confirmed the first - instance court ’s decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG . Proceedings before that court are still pending .

CARDINAL . LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( ORG за судовите ) of DATE ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) provides that “ ORG is competent to decide applications about a violation of the right to a hearing within a reasonable time , in proceedings specified by law . ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW provides that “ a party concerned can lodge with the immediate higher court ( непосредно повисокиот суд ) an application for the protection of the right to a hearing within a reasonable time if he or she considers that it has been violated by a court of competent jurisdiction . The immediate higher court considers the application ( постапува по барањето ) within DATE after it has been lodged and decides whether the court below violated the right to a hearing within a reasonable time . The higher court shall award just satisfaction to the claimant if it finds a violation of the right to a hearing within a reasonable time . The just satisfaction shall be paid from the ORG ’s budget . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act provides that it would become operational on DATE .
